name: Thistle Euston

reviews.text: I have never been to London before and stayed over - I had booked a west end show and accommodation through a company and I was slightly worried about the hotel as it was a last minute decision to stay here to another hotel not being able to accomadate us! Well ...... I needn't have worried!!!! What a well presented clean and friendly hotel!!! Helping with transport questions and even booking our taxi for us, the receptionist took an interested in our plans and treated us as somebody she knew while keeping a professional manner. We went to the restaurant for a drink before going out for the evening although was asked what we wanted to order, when we explained we just decided to have a drink was not pressured to have a meal.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I've stayed in

reviews.text: The only thing that let this hotel down was staff at breakfast for the amount of people that were there, there jus wasnt enough of them, we asked for tea an coffee which was brought to us, with milk(one small jug between 6) but no cups, we had to ask another member of staff for cups, the staffmember apologised so much and got our cups straight away and more milk!! Apart from the one staff member all the rest where attentive and doing a fantastic job.
reviews.title: Best of the corporate chains

reviews.text: The choice for breakfast was amazing!! Cereal (4kinds) yoghurt (2flavours) fresh fruit, full English, bread, a variety of rolls, and a varitey of pasteries there was also somebody cooking fresh omelettes (waiting time for these as they are cooked to order- choice of 5ish ingredients.. In our booking breakfast was included, but the menu in our room did have a charge on it so something to check.
reviews.title: Excellent service and so close to Euston station.
Utterly soulless and depressing corporate hotel
reviews.text: All in all I would stay at the thistle uston again if I come to the same part of London an I will be reccomending to people too.

.. Which I get to see quite a lot of. Here the checkin was warm and efficient and the room pleasant quiet and well equipped. Altogether good value. The breakfast is fine too though for better value check out Brizzi's in neighbouring Drummond street for a local alternative.
reviews.title: Perfect location..

reviews.text: Good location, very friendly staff, nice rooms, very fresh looking. Cant fault it. Right next to Euston Station and maybe a 10-15 minute walk to the start of the sites. Would stay here again for sure.
reviews.title: Perfect really for £126

reviews.text: hotel recently completed renovation and it shows, rooms and staff are superb and offered great location info - recommended the Crown and Alley Bar which is a few minutes walk away - one of the best British Pub's I've been too for a while, atmosphere and food was spot on.
reviews.title: like the local amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 5 Minutes from station, so 5 minutes walk to all tubes. Room large and quiet overlooking park. Breakfast very good, if you want omelette you may have to wait. Drinks expensive @ £4.65 for a pint of lager. Staff great. Taxi service outside door. Didn't see any local pubs around hotel. Left our bags with hotel on last day why we did some more sight seeing, this gave the option to increase our time in the capital. Would have give 5 stars but package we booked had 25% off drinks included, this was not deducted off bill because we should have been given discount card at check in. TIP if you do book hotel and are using Euston Station, thers's a short cut from the hotel road through side entrance into station.
reviews.title: GOOD

reviews.text: I checked in rather late but that was no problem, the guy at the reception was verry helpful and polite. I was expecting a verry smal room as I had reserved a single room but I was plesantly surprised when entering to find a larg double bed, Living area, large TV and nice and warm decorated room. Room is verry clean and quiet.
reviews.title: How to make customers happy

reviews.text: Breakfast is not included so I left without.
reviews.title: Perfect,the equivalent to a high quality and stylish hug

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for my friend and I to spend a weekend in London. We arrived early (11.30am) and even though check in wasn't until 2.00pm we were given a key to our room.
reviews.title: Excellent from start to finish

reviews.text: At first we were given a double room a mistake which was quickly rectified by the guy (sorry forgot his name) who checked us in. He even took is to the 2nd room and could not apologise enough for the mistake .
reviews.title: Overnight stay for Christmas Drinks Party.

reviews.text: Every member of staff were polite and friendly and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Slow check-in, noisy rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were very comfortable and bathroom spacious for a London hotel.
reviews.title: Not our greatest ever hotel experience!!!

reviews.text: Breakfast was very efficient and the staff very attentive. There was plenty to choose from and it was all well presented. The only little thing we thought could have improved was where the toaster was placed. This caused confusion with some guests who were waiting for the cooked breakfast.
reviews.title: Don't expect a good night sleep

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night based on works office been five minutes from here and also as I commute into London Euston.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Location (Euston Station)

reviews.text: Excellent hotel from start to finish of the stay, service, room and breakfast.
reviews.title: No sore points with this one!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I didn't spend too much time at the hotel as I went out into London on the evening. I stayed in an exec king room which was great, can't fault one part of the room. In room safe, iron and ironing board, comfy bed and and a good size flat screen tv. Bathroom was bright and modern, shower was hot and powerful.
reviews.title: Good Base for a Theatre Break

reviews.text: Breakfast was super. The service was spot on and the food and selection was really good. Would not hesitate to stay here again next time I'm in London overnight.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
Convenient to euston station
reviews.text: Hotel must have been refurbished recently as everything looks new and clean. Rooms are on the small size but well designed and they have everything you need. Bed was a small double but very comfortable and I had a good night's sleep. There seemed to be a problem with the hot water and I had a lukewarm shower and shave; I haven't marked down because of this as it was tolerable. The rooms at the front have old fashioned windows (I think they are called crittall) with secondary glazing providing a little more insulation. Not sure why they weren't replaced in the refurbishment as I could hear the street noise and feel the cold through them. Breakfast is in the basement restaurant, which looks cramped when full and I missed the natural light as there are (understandably) no windows. Would I stay again - definitely.

description: A fantastic hotel for business travellers and people on the move.Whether you’re in London for business or pleasure, Thistle Euston is one of the few hotels near Euston Station making it the ideal hotel for overnight or longer stays. At Thistle Euston, we have 362 newly refurbished bedrooms, including Deluxe, Family and Executive rooms, and 6 meeting rooms, the largest seating 100 people theatre-style. Business guests now also benefit from a new meet-and-greet point, a break-out area featuring high tables with laptop sockets and Costa coffee at a touch of a button.
